trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of Sulodexide in Overt Diabetic Nephropathy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The Collaborative Study Group Trial: The Effect of Sulodexide in Overt Type 2 Diabetic Nephropathy

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Sulodexide
Experimental: Sulodexide - Also known as KRX-101. These patients are also on standard of care ACEs and ARBs.
Placebo Comparator: Placebo - These patients were on standard of care ACEs and ARBs.
Treatment: drugs: Sulodexide

primaryOutcome.outcome: Time to doubling of the serum creatinine or end stage kidney disease (ESRD) - Time in study depended on time to doubling of serum creatinine and when the patient was enrolled in the trial.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Time in study depended on time to doubling of serum creatinine

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety and tolerance of sulodexide therapy long-term - Review of laboratory parameters, adverse events, physical examinations, etc. were made to evaluate patient safety.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Time in study depended on time to doubling of serum creatinine

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in urinary protein/albumin excretion - Review of urinary protein and albumin excretion was made as an additional assessment of kidney function.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Time in study depended on time to doubling of serum creatinine

recruitment.hospital: The Collaborative Study Group, Clinical Coordinating Center for the Pacific Region, Monash Medical Center - Clayton / Melbourne

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether sulodexide is effective in slowing or preventing the progression of diabetic kidney disease.

contact.name: Edmund J Lewis, MD
contact.address: The Collaborative Study Group, Rush University Medical Center, Chicago, IL USA
